comments:
I doubleclicked a breakpoint in Breakpoints-view (debug-perspective). I've 5 
breakpoints. Three of them produce the attached Exception. All three were 
deactivated.
I think (do'nt know exactly), that 2 breakpoints are breakpoints i had set, 
before a moving of my source files to another folder. So perhaps moving sources 
to other folders breaks breakpoints?
One breakpoint points to source i renamed using Rename. The resource name is the 
old name before renaming. I tried the same (create class, set breakpoint, 
rename), but renaming and moving now results in loss of breakpoints(bug or 
feature?)

Another aspect could be, that i copied the workspace directory from a former 
version to version 20011219, wich i use at the moment (could be there is a 
problem with breakpoints in "old" workspaces).

Error i get with doubleclick.

Is it possible for you to send me the workspace causing the problem?
If so please email to Darin_Swanson@oti.com.

Seems i can get a testcase for this. In short disabled breakpoints are not 
delete when its source-file is changed(renamed, moved). Seems in the underlying 
model they are deleted, but not in the persistence layer. So if i restart 
eclipse the already removed breakpoint is there again, of course with an 
invalid resource.
Perhaps i've got enough time at weekend.

I can reproduce the problem with your testcase. Thanks.
Working on a fix.

Fixed in the BreakpointManager.
We were not correctly handling the case where markers were moving (say for 
renaming a cu).

Verified that the breakpoints are correctly removed.

Opened Bug 7552 requesting that we create new breakpoints instead of just
deleting the old.

Could be the same root problem (I didn't see this as the default search doesn't 
pick up closed bugs).  I didn't take the time to examine the offending 
breakpoints, but it's possible that at least one of them was on something that 
was moved or renamed.  

Of course, my stack trace is a little different, and I was in the regular 
editor, not the debug perspective breakpoints view.  I will try to verify by 
moving a CU with a breakpoint, closing eclipse, and restarting. 

-Andrew
